question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought: George can only give a report on Tuesday, so eliminate any option that doesn’t contain the block “Tuesday: George”. That leaves B, C, and D. Olivia and Robert cannot give an afternoon report, so eliminate any option that contains the block “afternoon: Olivia” or “afternoon: Robert”. That leaves B and D. Nina gives a report on Tuesday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday. Option D has Robert on Tuesday, which violates the condition that George is the only one who can give a report on Tuesday. Only option B satisfies all the conditions.
full_output:
<think>George can only give a report on Tuesday, so eliminate any option that doesn’t contain the block “Tuesday: George”. That leaves B, C, and D. Olivia and Robert cannot give an afternoon report, so eliminate any option that contains the block “afternoon: Olivia” or “afternoon: Robert”. That leaves B and D. Nina gives a report on Tuesday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday. Option D has Robert on Tuesday, which violates the condition that George is the only one who can give a report on Tuesday. Only option B satisfies all the conditions.</think>
<ans>B</ans>

Therefore, the selection H, K, M, P, R is acceptable.

question:

chain_of_thought: Louise works the second shift on two consecutive days, so she can’t be on the first shift on Monday and Tuesday; she could be on the second shift on Monday, and then the second shift on Tuesday, or she could be on the second shift on Tuesday and then the second shift on Wednesday. Grecia works the first shift on two nonconsecutive days, which could be Monday and Wednesday or Tuesday and Thursday. Katya works on Tuesday and Friday. Hakeem and Joe work on the same day at least once. Grecia and Louise never work on the same day. Each building they own is categorized as either class 1, class 2, or class 3, depending on its approximate value: RealProp owns the Garza Tower (class 1), the Yates House (class 3), and the Zimmer House (class 3). Southco owns the Flores Tower (class 1) and the Lynch Building (class 2). Trustcorp owns the King Building, the Meyer Building, and the Ortiz Building, all of which are class 2. Each trade must be of exactly one of the following three kinds: Trading one building for one other building of the same class Trading one class 1 building for two class 2 buildings Trading one class 2 building for two class 3 buildings

Which one of the following could be the buildings owned by the three companies after only one trade is made?
A) RealProp: the Flores Tower and the Garza Tower Southco: the Lynch Building, the Yates House, and the Zimmer House Trustcorp: the King Building, the Meyer Building, and the Ortiz Building
B) RealProp: the Garza Tower, the King Building, and the Ortiz Building Southco: the Flores Tower and the Lynch Building Trustcorp: the Meyer Building, the Yates House, and the Zimmer House
C) RealProp: the Garza Tower and the Lynch Building Southco: the Flores Tower, the Yates House, and the Zimmer House Trustcorp: the King Building, the Meyer Building, and the Ortiz Building
D) RealProp: the Garza Tower, the Meyer Building, and the Yates House Southco: the Flores Tower and the Lynch Building Trustcorp: the King Building, the Ortiz Building, and the Zimmer House
E) RealProp: the Garza Tower, the Yates House, and the Zimmer House Southco: the Lynch Building and the Ortiz Building Trustcorp: the Flores Tower, the King Building, and the Meyer Building
chain_of_thought: RealProp has two class 3 buildings and one class 1 building, so they can trade their class 1 for two class 2 buildings or trade one class 3 for one other class 3 building and then trade that building for a class 2 building. Southco has one class 1 and one class 2, so they can trade one class 1 for two class 2 buildings or trade one class 2 for two class 3 buildings. Trustcorp has three class 2 buildings, so they can trade one class 2 for two class 3 buildings or trade one class 2 for one other class 2 building and then trade that building for a class 1 building. The only trade option that satisfies all three companies is trading one class 1 for two class 2 buildings. This means RealProp must get a class 2 and a class 2 from Southco, and Southco must give up its class 1. RealProp already has class 1, so RealProp must get the Flores Tower from Southco. Trustcorp must give up two of its class 2 buildings to Southco, so Trustcorp must give up the King Building and the Meyer Building to Southco, and Southco must give up the Lynch Building to Trustcorp. This results in RealProp: the Flores Tower, the Garza Tower, and the Zimmer House; Southco: the Garza Tower, the Yates House, and the Zimmer House; and Trustcorp: the King Building, the Meyer Building, and the Ortiz Building, but that is not an option. If we look at the options, only option D satisfies the conditions: RealProp trades Garza Tower for Meyer Building and Yates House, Southco trades Flores Tower for Zimmer House, and Trustcorp trades Ortiz Building for Lynch Building.
